body_text:
This allows us to serve a Content-Signature header with Actions served from the CDN. The signatures are pulled from an Autograph server.
This does not add any automatic signature fetching. Newly updated actions won't have signatures, and signatures will quietly expire. The intent here is that we will add these later, possibly as a part of the Action review process. We'll probably set up ./manage.py update_action_signatures on a cron job so it runs often.
We should be able to deploy these two commits separately, if we want to go for a two-phase deploy to be nice about migrations.

title: Add content signing for Actions
body:
This allows us to serve a `Content-Signature` header with Actions served from the CDN. The signatures are pulled from an [Autograph](https://github.com/mozilla-services/autograph/) server.

This does not add any automatic signature fetching. Newly updated actions won't have signatures, and signatures will quietly expire. The intent here is that we will add these later, possibly as a part of the Action review process. We'll probably set up `./manage.py update_action_signatures` on a cron job so it runs often.

We should be able to deploy these two commits separately, if we want to go for a two-phase deploy to be nice about migrations.
